self_contained_context.background: CI environments require specific output formatting: no ANSI colors (breaks log parsing), verbose output by default (no interactive prompts), and proper exit codes for pipeline integration.
prerequisites: 01-01: Error Codes Module must be complete
01-02: Context Detector - Terminal/Claude Detection must be complete
01-03: Context Detector - CI/Container Detection must be complete
03-01: Terminal Error Formatting must be complete
03-02: Claude Code JSON Formatting must be complete
self_contained_context.technical_context: Extend output_formatter.py with CI-specific formatting. When context_detector.is_ci_environment() returns true: disable ANSI colors, enable verbose output, disable interactive prompts. Add format_ci_error() method and proper exit code handling.

task_specification.name: CI Mode Output Formatting
task_specification.description: Extend output_formatter.py with CI-specific formatting: no ANSI colors, verbose output by default, no interactive prompts.
task_specification.motivation: CI pipelines need clean output for log parsing and proper exit codes for build status reporting.
task_specification.detailed_instructions: 1. Add format_ci_error() function to output_formatter.py. 2. Disable ANSI colors when in CI mode. 3. Enable verbose output by default. 4. Disable interactive prompts. 5. Ensure proper exit codes (0 for success, non-zero for failure). 6. Create tests/unit/test_output_formatter_ci.py.
task_specification.acceptance_criteria: CI mode disables ANSI color codes in output; CI mode enables verbose output by default; CI mode disables interactive prompts; CI mode returns non-zero exit code on failure; CI mode returns zero exit code on success
